methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.config_bucket
params.description: Optional. A Cloud Storage bucket used to stage job dependencies, config files, and job driver console output. If you do not specify a staging bucket, Cloud Dataproc will determine a Cloud Storage location (US, ASIA, or EU) for your cluster's staging bucket according to the Compute Engine zone where your cluster is deployed, and then create and manage this project-level, per-location bucket (see Dataproc staging bucket).

params.name: data.gce_cluster_config
params.description: Optional. The shared Compute Engine config settings for all instances in a cluster.

params.name: data.master_config
params.description: Optional. The Compute Engine config settings for the master instance in a cluster.

params.name: data.worker_config
params.description: Optional. The Compute Engine config settings for worker instances in a cluster.

params.name: data.secondary_worker_config
params.description: Optional. The Compute Engine config settings for additional worker instances in a cluster.

params.name: data.software_config
params.description: Optional. The config settings for software inside the cluster.

params.name: data.lifecycle_config
params.description: Optional. The config setting for auto delete cluster schedule.

params.name: data.initialization_actions
params.description: Optional. Commands to execute on each node after config is completed. By default, executables are run on master and all worker nodes. You can test a node's role metadata to run an executable on a master or worker node, as shown below using curl (you can also use wget): ROLE=$(curl -H Metadata-Flavor:Google http://metadata/computeMetadata/v1beta2/instance/attributes/dataproc-role) if [[ "${ROLE}" == 'Master' ]]; then ... master specific actions ... else ... worker specific actions ... fi

params.name: data.encryption_config
params.description: Optional. Encryption settings for the cluster.

params.name: data.autoscaling_config
params.description: Optional. Autoscaling config for the policy associated with the cluster. Cluster does not autoscale if this field is unset.

params.name: data.endpoint_config
params.description: Optional. Port/endpoint configuration for this cluster

params.name: data.security_config
params.description: Optional. Security related configuration.

params.name: data.gke_cluster_config
params.description: Optional. The Kubernetes Engine config for Dataproc clusters deployed to Kubernetes. Setting this is considered mutually exclusive with Compute Engine-based options such as gce_cluster_config, master_config, worker_config, secondary_worker_config, and autoscaling_config.

methods.name: getConfigBucket
methods.description:
Optional. A Cloud Storage bucket used to stage job dependencies, config files, and job driver console output.

If you do not specify a staging bucket, Cloud Dataproc will determine a Cloud Storage location (US, ASIA, or EU) for your cluster's staging bucket according to the Compute Engine zone where your cluster is deployed, and then create and manage this project-level, per-location bucket (see Dataproc staging bucket).

Generated from protobuf field string config_bucket = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.description:

Generated from protobuf field string config_bucket = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.name: getInitializationActions
methods.description:
Optional. Commands to execute on each node after config is completed. By default, executables are run on master and all worker nodes.

You can test a node's role metadata to run an executable on a master or worker node, as shown below using curl (you can also use wget): ROLE=$(curl -H Metadata-Flavor:Google http://metadata/computeMetadata/v1beta2/instance/attributes/dataproc-role) if [[ "${ROLE}" == 'Master' ]]; then ... master specific actions ... else ... worker specific actions ... fi

Generated from protobuf field repeated .google.cloud.dataproc.v1beta2.NodeInitializationAction initialization_actions = 11 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.description:

Generated from protobuf field repeated .google.cloud.dataproc.v1beta2.NodeInitializationAction initialization_actions = 11 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];
